rmcWidget.desc2: Reaching 80-90% of your MHR can be beneficial for improving strength and speed

information.title: Information

aboutSection.desc1: This app is your ideal companion to achieve your health and wellness goals through a holistic approach to food management and fitness tracking. Our app is designed to help you keep a detailed record of your eating habits and calculate essential metrics that will allow you to better understand your body composition and optimize your nutrition.
aboutSection.desc2: Not only will you learn to manage your food effectively, but you will also gain a deeper understanding of how your diet and training impact your overall health. Whether you are a beginner in the world of fitness or an experienced athlete, our app provides the necessary tools to empower you on your journey to a healthier lifestyle.
aboutSection.title: Key Features
aboutSection.section1Desc: Log and track your daily meals with an extensive food database. Access accurate nutritional information to help you make informed decisions about what you eat.
aboutSection.section2Desc: The app allows you to calculate and adjust your daily intake of macronutrients (carbohydrates, proteins, and fats) according to your specific goals, whether it's for weight loss, muscle gain, or maintaining a balanced diet.
aboutSection.section3Title: Body Fat and Muscle Percentage Calculation
aboutSection.section3Desc: Use tools to estimate your body fat percentage and lean muscle mass, allowing you to get a clearer picture of your body composition and adjust your diet and training accordingly.
aboutSection.section4Desc: Calculate your BMR to determine how many calories your body needs at rest, which will help you create a personalized and effective meal plan.
aboutSection.section5Desc: Genetic muscle gain prediction is key to customizing training, setting realistic goals, and optimizing nutrition based on individual predisposition. This not only maximizes muscle growth efficiency and athletic performance but also helps prevent injuries and maintain long-term motivation, driving research into more effective training and nutrition strategies.
aboutSection.section6Desc: Aesthetic body measurements are important because they reflect the perception of body image, influencing self-esteem, confidence, and psychological well-being. Achieving certain aesthetic standards can improve personal satisfaction, encourage healthy habits such as exercise and a balanced diet, and promote positive social interactions. While it's crucial to balance aesthetics with health and avoid obsession, aesthetic measurements can serve as motivation for self-care and the pursuit of a better quality of life.
aboutSection.section7Desc: Set nutrition and training goals tailored to your individual needs, and monitor your progress over time. The app will send you reminders and motivation to stay focused on your goals.
aboutSection.section8Desc: Generate reports on your daily intake, body composition progress, and eating habits, providing valuable information to make adjustments and improve your approach to health.

information.neckDesc: Place the measuring tape below the Adam’s apple at the narrowest point.
information.chestDesc: Place the measuring tape under the armpits at nipple level while staying relaxed.
information.bicepsDesc: Wrap the measuring tape around the center of the biceps at its widest point while flexed.
information.forearmDesc: Wrap the measuring tape around the widest part of the forearm with the fist clenched and the arm straight.
information.waistDesc: Wrap the measuring tape around the waist just above the belly button.
information.hipDesc: Wrap the measuring tape around the hips at pelvis height.
information.thighDesc: Wrap the measuring tape around the center of the relaxed thigh.
information.calfDesc: Wrap the measuring tape around the calf at its thickest part.
information.imcDesc: The Body Mass Index (BMI) is a useful tool for evaluating the relationship between a person's weight and height, providing an estimate of body fat.
information.rmcDesc: Maximum Heart Rate (MHR) is the highest heart rate a person can reach during intense physical activity.
information.pgcDesc: Calculating body fat percentage is important for assessing body composition and overall health. There are different methods to estimate this percentage. Navy Formula: Uses waist and neck circumference (and hips for women) along with height to estimate body fat percentage. YMCA Formula: Based on height and weight to estimate body fat percentage, although it is less accurate than other methodologies. Calculating body fat percentage provides a more complete view of health and fitness than body weight alone. However, it's advisable to combine these methods with other health measures for a more accurate and holistic evaluation.
information.pmmDesc: Calculating lean muscle percentage is useful to gain a more detailed understanding of a person’s body composition. This percentage refers to the amount of muscle mass relative to total body weight, excluding fat.
information.tmbDesc: Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) is the amount of energy the body expends at rest to maintain vital functions such as breathing, blood circulation, body temperature regulation, and organ function. It is a key indicator of the body's energy needs at rest and serves as a basis for customizing workouts and nutrition plans. With a proper understanding of BMR, athletes and individuals interested in improving their health can optimize their performance and reach their goals more effectively and healthily.
information.pgmDesc: Predicting muscle gain based on genetics is important for several reasons, both for athletes and for individuals looking to improve their body composition. Genetics plays a fundamental role in a person's ability to gain muscle, and by recognizing its influence, training, nutrition, and recovery can be optimized. This not only improves results but also supports overall health and well-being, providing a more conscious and personalized approach to physical development.
information.cdmDesc: Knowing how daily macronutrient intake should be structured is essential for maintaining optimal health, achieving fitness goals, and improving physical performance. This involves not only a detailed understanding of macronutrients but also how they interact in the body and influence our daily lives. In the end, a well-planned and balanced diet is key to achieving a healthy and sustainable lifestyle.
information.meiDesc: Knowing the aesthetically ideal measurements for different parts of the body can have several implications, both in terms of health and emotional well-being and self-esteem. It can guide the development of a training and nutrition plan and promote self-acceptance. However, it is important to approach this knowledge with a balanced mindset, considering personal health and well-being above social or cultural ideals. The key is to find an approach that promotes not only appearance but also personal health and happiness.
